critique: This document is an executive order regarding the inspection of tax returns by a House committee. It is difficult to assess its ideological tilt without more context, but it seems related to oversight and investigation. Immigration is not relevant. It could be argued that allowing inspection expands executive power slightly by enabling investigations, but it also empowers the legislative branch. Federalism is not directly addressed. National security vs. civil liberties is implicated as it involves access to private tax information, but it is for a specific investigation. Economic regulation is not directly relevant. Social inclusion is not directly relevant.
